# Sinner **Sinner** refers to a [person](/article/en/Person) who commits a [sin](/article/en/Sin). The term is also used as a name for various people, works of art, entertainment, and other entities. ## People ### Contemporary figures * [Jannik Sinner](/article/en/Jannik_Sinner) (born 2001), Italian [tennis](/article/en/Tennis) player * [George A. Sinner](/article/en/George_A._Sinner) (1928–2018), American [politician](/article/en/Politician) and 29th [Governor of North Dakota](/article/en/Governor_of_North_Dakota) * [George B. Sinner](/article/en/George_B._Sinner), American politician * [Martin Sinner](/article/en/Martin_Sinner) (born 1968), German tennis player * [Mat Sinner](/article/en/Mat_Sinner) (born 1963–1964), German [musician](/article/en/Musician), [bassist](/article/en/Bassist), singer and music producer * [Benoît Sinner](/article/en/Benoît_Sinner) (born 1984), French professional [cyclist](/article/en/Cyclist) ### Historical figures * [Carl Ahasver von Sinner](/article/en/Carl_Ahasver_von_Sinner) (1754–1821), Swiss [architect](/article/en/Architect) * [Friedrich Sinner](/article/en/Friedrich_Sinner) (1713–1791), Swiss politician, [Schultheiss](/article/en/Schultheiss) of [Bern](/article/en/Bern) * [Johann Rudolf Sinner](/article/en/Johann_Rudolf_Sinner) (various individuals, 1632–1782), Swiss statesmen, politicians, magistrates and diplomats * [Johann Rudolf von Sinner](/article/en/Johann_Rudolf_von_Sinner) (1830–1901), Swiss Chief of the General Staff and Bernese politician * [Basilius Sinner](/article/en/Basilius_Sinner) OSB (1745–1827), German [Benedictine](/article/en/Benedictine) and inventor * [Paul Sinner](/article/en/Paul_Sinner) (1838–1925), German [photographer](/article/en/Photographer) * [Norbert Sinner](/article/en/Norbert_Sinner) (1907–1945), Luxembourgish professional cyclist * [Rudolf Sinner](/article/en/Rudolf_Sinner) (1884–1950), German entrepreneur * [Wilhelm Sinner](/article/en/Wilhelm_Sinner) (1915–1976), German [urologist](/article/en/Urologist) * [Peter Sinner](/article/en/Peter_Sinner) (Johann Peter Sinner; 1879–1935), Russian-German author and victim of [Stalin's purges](/article/en/Great_Purge) * [Otto Haberer-Sinner](/article/en/Otto_Haberer-Sinner) (1866–1941), German-Swiss [painter](/article/en/Painter) * [Rudolf von Sinner](/article/en/Rudolf_von_Sinner) (1890–1960), Swiss [architect](/article/en/Architect) * [Eberhard Sinner](/article/en/Eberhard_Sinner) (born 1944), German politician * [Carsten Sinner](/article/en/Carsten_Sinner) (born 1971), German [translation studies](/article/en/Translation_studies) scholar and university lecturer * [Karl Friedrich Sinner](/article/en/Karl_Friedrich_Sinner) (1946–2017), German forestry scientist * [Rudolf von Sinner](/article/en/Rudolf_von_Sinner_(Theologe)) (born 1967), Swiss theologian and university lecturer * [Stefan Sinner](/article/en/Stefan_Sinner) (born 1969), German [jurist](/article/en/Jurist) and judge at the [Federal Administrative Court](/article/en/Federal_Administrative_Court_(Germany)) ## Film and Television ### Films * [The Sinner](/article/en/The_Sinner_(1928_film)) (1928), German silent [drama](/article/en/Drama_film) film * [The Sinner](/article/en/The_Sinner_(1940_film)) (1940), Italian drama film * [The Sinner](/article/en/The_Sinner_(1951_film)) (1951), German drama film * [The Sinner](/article/en/The_Sinner_(1975_film)) (1975), Italian drama film * *[Sinner](/article/en/Sinner_(1972_film))* (1972), Spanish film directed by [Jesús Franco](/article/en/Jesús_Franco), also known as "Intimate Diary of a Nymphomaniac" * *[La ragazza dalla pelle di luna](/article/en/La_ragazza_dalla_pelle_di_luna)* (1973), Italian film also known as "The Sinner" * [Sinner](/article/en/Sinner_(2007_film)) (2007), film starring [Nick Chinlund](/article/en/Nick_Chinlund) and [Georgina Cates](/article/en/Georgina_Cates), directed by [Marc Benardout](/article/en/Marc_Benardout) * [Saint Sinner](/article/en/Saint_Sinner) (2002), horror film directed by [Joshua Butler](/article/en/Joshua_Butler) ### Television * [The Sinner](/article/en/The_Sinner_(TV_series)) (2017–present), American [anthology series](/article/en/Anthology_series) in the [crime](/article/en/Crime_fiction) genre, based on the [novel](/article/en/Novel) of the same name by [Petra Hammesfahr](/article/en/Petra_Hammesfahr), starring [Jessica Biel](/article/en/Jessica_Biel) ## Literature * [The Sinner](/article/en/The_Sinner_(novel)) (2003), novel by [Tess Gerritsen](/article/en/Tess_Gerritsen) * *The Sinner* (2003), novel by [Madeline Hunter](/article/en/Madeline_Hunter) * *[Sinner](/article/en/Sinner_(Dekker_novel))* (2008), fantasy novel by [Ted Dekker](/article/en/Ted_Dekker) * *[Sinner](/article/en/Sinner_(Douglass_novel))* (1997), fantasy novel by [Sara Douglass](/article/en/Sara_Douglass) * *[Sinner](/article/en/Sinner_(Rulli_book))* (2011), religious book by [Lino Rulli](/article/en/Lino_Rulli) ## Music ### Bands and musical groups * [Sinner](/article/en/Sinner_(band)), German [heavy metal](/article/en/Heavy_metal_music) band ### Albums * *[Sinner](/article/en/Sinner_(Joan_Jett_album))* (2006), album by [Joan Jett](/article/en/Joan_Jett) * *[Sinner](/article/en/Sinner_(Drowning_Pool_album))* (2001), album by [Drowning Pool](/article/en/Drowning_Pool) * *[Sinner](/article/en/Sinner_(Dave_Evans_album))* (2004), album by [Dave Evans](/article/en/Dave_Evans_(musician)) * *[Sinner](/article/en/Sinner_(Aaron_Lewis_album))* (2016), album by [Aaron Lewis](/article/en/Aaron_Lewis) ### Songs * "[Sinner](/article/en/Sinner_(Judas_Priest_song))" (1977), song by [Judas Priest](/article/en/Judas_Priest) * "[Sinner](/article/en/Sinner_(Drowning_Pool_song))" (2001/2002), song by [Drowning Pool](/article/en/Drowning_Pool) * "[Sinner](/article/en/Sinner_(Neil_Finn_song))" (1998), song by [Neil Finn](/article/en/Neil_Finn) from the album [Try Whistling This](/article/en/Try_Whistling_This) * "[Sinner](/article/en/Sinner_(Andy_Grammer_song))" (2014), song by [Andy Grammer](/article/en/Andy_Grammer) * "[Sinner](/article/en/Sinner_(The_Last_Dinner_Party_song))" (2023), song by [The Last Dinner Party](/article/en/The_Last_Dinner_Party) ## Video Games * [Sinner: Sacrifice for Redemption](/article/en/Sinner:_Sacrifice_for_Redemption) (2018), action video game ## Other Uses ### Military and weaponry * [SS-16 Sinner](/article/en/SS-16_Sinner), [NATO](/article/en/NATO) reporting name for the [RT-21 Temp 2S](/article/en/RT-21_Temp_2S) (also known as RS-14 Temp-2S), Soviet [intercontinental ballistic missile](/article/en/Intercontinental_ballistic_missile) ### Comic books * [Alack Sinner](/article/en/Alack_Sinner), noir/[crime](/article/en/Crime_fiction) [comic book](/article/en/Comic_book) series ### Business and organizations * [Sinner (Company)](/article/en/Sinner_(Company)), former large [brewery](/article/en/Brewery) in [Karlsruhe](/article/en/Karlsruhe), today a publicly listed [real estate](/article/en/Real_estate) company ### Historical families * [Sinner (Patrician family)](/article/en/Sinner_(Patrician_family)), [Bernese](/article/en/Bern) patrician family * [Sinner Family](/article/en/Sinner_Family), broader historical family from [Bern](/article/en/Bern), [Switzerland](/article/en/Switzerland) ## See also *
